newsitem.title: ITALY: Italian minister sees progress in pay dispute.
newsitem.headline: Italian minister sees progress in pay dispute.

text.p: Italian Labour Minister Tiziano Treu said on Saturday "a final effort" was required to reach a deal between employers and engineering and metalworkers in their protracted pay dispute.

"I think we have to make a final effort. It's been too long, too many months, that a million and a half workers have been waiting for this: so we're giving it all we've got," Treu told reporters in Milan.
Treu was due to meet representatives of the workers' three trades unions later on Saturday in Rome to iron out the final details of a possible settlement of the bitter dispute.
"Progress has been made," he said, adding that he hoped a deal would be reached "soon" even if "it is always best to be vigilant until the very end".
Union leaders had said on Thursday that they hoped a deal could be reached by Sunday.

Talks between unions and employers resumed last Monday for the first time in more than a month to try to end the dispute which involves some 1.7 million workers in a sector which accounts for 40 percent of industrial output.
The sector's two-year contract expired in June.
Any deal is likely to set the tone for other pay accords andy prove key to Italy's hopes of containing inflation.
